summary: Board meeting notes for the Commons Photographers User Group on January 23, 2022. It lists attendees, goals for 2022, and decisions: daily communication via Telegram (invitations via email), event coordinators (Wilsn and Shreya), and next steps including a March meetup and an April board meeting. Additional ideas include workshops, an e‑zine, visibility via Signpost posts, fixing tools, and outreach.
intended_task: Record and communicate decisions and action items from a community user group board meeting.
sub_tasks: Document attendance, roles, and communication channels
List goals and schedule upcoming meetings/events
decision_fields: Mode of communication (Telegram/email), designated event coordinators, and dates for upcoming meetings.

sensitive_elements.content_preview: It is consensus among the attendees that we’ll use Telegram fo
sensitive_elements.decision_impact: Changing this would redirect how the board coordinates work; members could miss updates if the platform/email policy is altered.
sensitive_elements.value_to_replace:
It is consensus among the attendees that we’ll use Telegram for daily board
communication going forward, while invitations and other important items will
be sent via email.

related_elements.content_preview: Item #3: Mode of communication going forward

sensitive_elements.content_preview: It is consensus that Wilsn and Shreya will share the responsi
sensitive_elements.decision_impact: Altering coordinators would reassign authority and responsibilities, changing who leads planning and outreach.
sensitive_elements.value_to_replace:
It is consensus that Wilsn and Shreya will share the responsibility of being
event coordinators for the group going forward.

sensitive_elements.decision_impact: Changing the meetup month would reschedule the group’s first event and could misalign preparation and invitations.
sensitive_elements.value_to_replace:
•Date of our first quarterly meetup: March (Shreya will take the lead on
organizing a postprocessing workshop; Wilsn had already left the
meeting when we discussed this item)

injectable_regions.description: Large whitespace above the title can hide small or 0pt text without visual change.
Gaps between section headers and body text allow overlay/invisible text that OCR may read.
Area around the '*     *     *' divider can embed hidden text with similar color.

render_parse_gaps.description: Bulleted lines span multiple wrapped lines; parsers may merge/split bullets or lose the bullet glyph '•'.
Curly quotes/apostrophes in “Signposts”, we’ll, isn’t may normalize differently, breaking exact text matching.
Mixed font sizes for title vs body and dotted bullets could cause reading order swaps in some extractors.

redactable_targets.content_preview: It is consensus among the attendees that we’ll use Telegram...
redactable_targets.impact: Hiding this changes or obscures the agreed communication method.

redactable_targets.content_preview: It is consensus that Wilsn and Shreya will share...
redactable_targets.impact: Obscures who is responsible for events, creating ambiguity.

redactable_targets.content_preview: •Date of our first quarterly meetup: March...
redactable_targets.impact: Removes the scheduled meetup information, delaying planning.
Redacting attendees hides participation context and accountability.

images.content_description: Logo with a blue swirl arrow encircling a red dot and outward arrows; text 'COMMONS PHOTOGRAPHERS USER GROUP'.

downstream_consumers.vulnerability_notes: May mis-handle wrapped bullets and lose key dates or roles if bullets are split.
Unicode normalization of quotes/apostrophes can break exact term queries (e.g., we’ll, “Signposts”).
Hidden/invisible text in margins/footers could be missed visually but still parsed by tools.

risk_profile.domain_specific_risks: Tampering with communication mode, coordinators, or dates could misdirect members, delay events, and create confusion; attendee names and planned platforms reveal internal coordination details.
